header_summary:
Antoine Poinsot highlighted the release of security advisories for Bitcoin Core, emphasizing the project's commitment to transparent security practices and the implementation of a publicly advertised disclosure policy. This move, detailed on their [official website](https://bitcoincore.org/en/security-advisories), signifies a significant step towards enhancing the security and transparency of Bitcoin Core's operations.

Adam Borcany introduced a novel approach to Bitcoin transaction security by proposing a method for adjusting the difficulty of proof-of-work (PoW) locked outputs using short DER-encoded ECDSA signatures, aiming for a more granular difficulty adjustment mechanism. This method, which is more efficient and flexible than traditional signature grinding, is detailed in his discussion, offering a potential advancement in securing Bitcoin transactions against unauthorized modifications. The practicality of this concept is demonstrated through a [Node.JS application](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAOY=fzk-ksDGT_oyCKF=EJnnXaXoCbfCzxW+9PBQV=us-K=PuQ@mail.gmail.com/T/#u#m6466fc7480c6cde4dc938a788051920242c7231c).

Murch and cndolo, in separate discussions, explored innovative ways to improve the Bitcoin ecosystem. Murch questioned traditional transaction selection methods for blockchain blocks, proposing a Smart Mempool-Based Forecaster that considers temporal proximity rather than confirmation status, potentially increasing efficiency in block creation. This idea is explored further at [DelvingBitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/empirical-data-analysis-of-fee-rate-forecasters-for-asap-next-block-fee-estimation/1022/2). Cndolo's research shed light on the Lightning Network's vulnerability to censorship and privacy attacks, emphasizing the need for countermeasures against network-level adversaries and suggesting enhancements to protect against censorship, detailed in their [study](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/research-paper-on-ln-payment-censorship/1248).

ZmnSCPxj introduced the SuperScalar mechanism to address the LSP Last-Mile Problem in the Lightning Network, offering a scalable and secure method to provide incoming liquidity for new users without blockchain consensus changes. This construction utilizes Decker-Wattenhofer channel factories among other innovations, aiming to improve liquidity provisioning and scalability in a decentralized manner, as elaborated in their [proposal](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/superscalar-laddered-timeout-tree-structured-decker-wattenhofer-factories-with-pseudo-spilman-leaves/1242).

recent_posts.title: Public disclosure of one vulnerability affecting Bitcoin Core <26.0
recent_posts.summary:
- Recent security advisories for Bitcoin Core are now available online.
- New vulnerabilities will follow the disclosed policy on their security advisories page.
- The process initiated in July enhances Bitcoin Core's commitment to security transparency.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin PoW locked outputs with arbitrary difficulty
recent_posts.summary:
- A novel PoW approach for Bitcoin increases adjustment granularity beyond traditional signature grinding.
- This method uses fixed signatures and private key intervals for flexible difficulty adjustments.
- It promises more scalable and precise security for Bitcoin transactions against modifications.

recent_posts.title: Empirical Data Analysis of Fee Rate Forecasters for ASAP (next-block) Fee Estimation
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a Smart Mempool-Based Forecaster for predicting blockchain transactions.
- It critiques the traditional transaction selection process, proposing a time-based approach.
- The suggested method prioritizes transactions by their submission time, not confirmation status.

recent_posts.title: Research Paper on LN Payment Censorship
recent_posts.summary:
- Significant findings reveal LN's vulnerability to censorship by AS through privacy attacks.
- Research shows an attack model where malicious AS can selectively disrupt LN payments undetected.
- Mitigation strategies include using Tor and adaptive padding, yet challenges remain against sophisticated attacks.

recent_posts.title: SuperScalar: Laddered Timeout-Tree-Structured Decker-Wattenhofer Factories With Pseudo-Spilman Leaves
recent_posts.summary:
- SuperScalar mechanism addresses Bitcoin's LSP Last-Mile Problem with innovative liquidity provisioning solutions.
- It ensures security, scalability, and independent operation without Bitcoin blockchain consensus changes.
- The approach incorporates four key components for robustness and offers practical implementation considerations.

active_posts.title: libsecp256k1 v0.6.0 released
active_posts.summary:
- Version 0.6.0 of libsecp256k1 introduces a MuSig2 module and security enhancements.
- It also simplifies the library by removing unused functions for better efficiency.
- Full changelog details are accessible on the project's GitHub page for interested users.

active_posts.title: File Format for Wallet Inheritance and Recovery
active_posts.summary:
- Robert Netzke proposes a new file format for Bitcoin wallets for easier inheritance.
- The format includes wallet metadata to aid in fund recovery and ensure service interoperability.
- It features a reference implementation in Rust and seeks feedback on its utility.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 27.2 released
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 27.2 has been released, featuring bug fixes and enhancements.
- Users can upgrade by first shutting down their current version, with detailed guidance provided.
- The update improves various components and supports older wallets, with broad OS compatibility.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The Great Consensus Cleanup proposal scrutinizes Bitcoin’s flaws, suggesting improvements for security and performance.
- Solutions include adjusting mining difficulty and transaction rules to prevent exploits and enhance stability.
- While some proposed changes like reducing block size stir debate, overall suggestions aim at refining Bitcoin's protocol.

active_posts.title: Libbitcoin for Core people
active_posts.summary:
- Eric Voskuil reveals Libbitcoin's IBD outperforms Bitcoin Core, using `-assumevalid` for higher speed.
- Libbitcoin optimizes block validation through asynchronous tasks and relational database organization.
- Despite efficiency gains, Libbitcoin's future updates and current limitations include DoS protection and outdated libraries.

active_posts.title: A Fast, Scalable Protocol For Resolving Lightning Payments
active_posts.summary:
- The OPR protocol improves Lightning network payments, resolving small transactions off-chain swiftly.
- It introduces mechanisms to deter dishonesty by penalizing bad actors, enhancing security.
- The protocol's design facilitates scalability and integration with technologies for better payment resolution.

today_in_history_posts.title: Draft BIP for SNICKER
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a solution to Bitcoin's watch-only issue using a coinjoin transaction strategy.
- Adam describes a tweak needed for secure transaction monitoring, incompatible with classic watch-only setups.
- He concludes the exchange as useful, touching on AES encryption and security concerns regarding the proposer's trustworthiness.

today_in_history_posts.title: asynchronous Lightning network payments
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The email details asynchronous payment solutions for the Lightning Network using the Lightning Rod Protocol.
- It suggests a system where transactions are pre-signed and sold, facilitating asynchronous payments with locked funds.
- Proposed improvements include using Rod nodes for privacy and exploring Trampoline implementations for automatic polling.

today_in_history_posts.title: Cluster Mempool RBF Thoughts
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal discusses optimizing blockchain transactions with Replace-By-Fee in mempools.
- It compares two strategies for improving mempool quality through transaction replacement.
- Challenges in ensuring mempool enhancement through heuristic methods are highlighted.
